intro: Podosemum strictum, commonly known as the rigid podosemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
